definition: To read a text from beginning to end, typically referring to the act of reading a book, article, or document thoroughly and completely. It implies the action of going through the entire content without skipping or omitting any parts.

examples.english: I will read the book through.

examples.german: Kannst du bitte den Text durchlesen?
examples.english: Can you please read through the text?

examples.german: Er hat den Vertrag nicht gr√ºndlich durchgelesen.
examples.english: He didn't read the contract thoroughly.

examples.german: Ich muss noch die E-Mails durchlesen.
examples.english: I still need to go through the emails.

examples.german: Sie sollten die Anleitung vor der Benutzung durchlesen.
examples.english: You should read the instructions before using it.
